content.description:
The table below gives the value of various monetary measures, in millions of dollars.

Cash in Circulation
 <math overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mi mathvariant="normal">$</mi> <mn>100</mn> </math>

Certificates of Deposit
 <math overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mi mathvariant="normal">$</mi> <mn>2</mn> </math>

Bank Reserves
 <math overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mi mathvariant="normal">$</mi> <mn>10</mn> </math>

Demand Deposits
 <math overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mi mathvariant="normal">$</mi> <mtext>1,000</mtext> </math>

Savings Deposits
 <math overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mi mathvariant="normal">$</mi> <mn>20</mn> </math>
content.question: Based on the table above, what is the value of the monetary base?

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Identify an economic concept, principle, or model using quantitative data or calculations.
